# {{< bi image >}} Figure

::: {#fig-LROC_poles layout-ncol=2}
![Lunar north pole.](imgs/LROC_poles/LROC_north_pole.jpg){#fig-LROC_north_pole}

![Lunar south pole.](imgs/LROC_poles/LROC_south_pole.jpg){#fig-LROC_south_pole}

[LROC](/documentation/acronyms.qmd) Wide Angle Camera ([WAC](/documentation/acronyms.qmd)) mosaic of the lunar north and south pole region. With a resolution of 400m/pixel, the total width of each image extends to ~600km, ranging from 80° to 90° latitude, north and south, respectively. The names of major craters are indicated at their respective location. _Image Credit: NASA/GSFC/Arizona State University: [North Pole](http://lroc.sese.asu.edu/posts/242), [South Pole](http://lroc.sese.asu.edu/posts/237>)_.
:::
